Name.BusinessNameLine1: THE DUSABLE MUSEUM OF AFRICAN AMERICAN HISTORY

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: MUSEUM EXHIBITS AND PROGRAMS SUPPORTED BY THE PUBLIC
IRS990.MissionDescription: AFRICAN AMERICAN MUSEUM DEDICATED TO THE DOCUMENTATION, COLLECTION, PRESERVATION, INTERPRETATION AND DISSEMENATION OF THE HISTORY AND CULTURE OF AFRICANS AND AMERICANS OF AFRICAN DECENT.
IRS990.Description: MUSEUM EXHIBIT AND PROGRAM EVENTS SUPPORTED BY THE PUBLIC. PROGRAMS SCHEDULED FOR INTEREST GROUPS, SCHOOLS, AND INDIVIDUALS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: COLLECTION ITEMS CONSIST OF ART OBJECTS THAT ARE HELD FOR EDUCATIONAL AND CURATORIAL PURPOSES. EACH OF THE ITEMS IS CATALOGED, PRESERVED, AND CARED FOR, AND ACTIVITIES VERIFYING THEIR EXISTENCE AND ASSESSING THEIR CONDITION ARE PERFORMED CONTINUOUSLY. COLLECTION ITEMS ACQUIRED EITHER THROUGH PURCHASE OR DONATION ARE NOT CAPITALIZED. PURCHASES OF COLLECTION ITEMS ARE RECORDED AS DECREASES IN UNRESTRICTED NET ASSETS IF PURCHASED WITH UNRESTRICTED ASSETS AND, AS DECREASES IN TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED OR PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS IF PURCHASED WITH DONOR-RESTRICTED ASSETS. CONTRIBUTIONS OF COLLECTION ITEMS ARE NOT RECOGNIZED IN THE STATEMENT OF ACTIVITIES. PROCEEDS FROM DEACCESSIONS OR INSURANCE RECOVERIES ARE REFLECTED IN THE STATEMENT OF ACTIVITIES BASED ON THE ABSENCE OR EXISTENCE AND NATURE OF DONOR-IMPOSED RESTRICTIONS. COLLECTION ITEMS ARE PROTECTED, KEPT UNENCUMBERED, CARED FOR AND PRESERVED.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF INTENDED USE OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: DUSABLE ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE TO BE USED TO SPONSOR INTERNSHIPS AND GENERAL OPERATIONS

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: WHEN THE FORM 990 IS COMPLETED BY THE INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT A COPY IS PROVIDED TO THE AUDIT/FINANCE COMMITTEE, THEN TO ALL THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD FOR REVIEW. AFTER REVIEW AND APPROVAL THE TAX RETURNS ARE FILED WITH THE REGULATORY AUTHORITIES.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND ENFORCES IT BY REQUIRING THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS TO SIGN AND ACKNOWLEDGE ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICT.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE REVIEW OF THE PRESIDENT AND CEO IS CONDUCTED ANNUALLY, BOARD MEMBERS REVIEW, DELIBERATE AND PRESENT RESULTS AND DETERMINE COMPENSATION.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAINTAINS ITS OWN WEBSITE AND PROVIDES INFORMATION ABOUT ITS ACTIVITIES AND THOSE WHO NEED MORE INFORMATION ARE DIRECTED TO OBTAIN UPON REQUEST. THE 990 IS ALSO AVAILABLE ON GUIDESTAR.ORG.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES INFORMATION ABOUT ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTATION, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS UPON REQUEST.
THERE HAS BEEN NO CHANGE IN THE PROCESS FOR THE OVERSIGHT OF AUDIT AND THE SELECTION OF AUDITORS FROM LAST YEAR.
